channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Gen Z has a different attitude about dining from baby boomers and millennials—and it shows in smaller tickets at chain restaurants
item.description: The younger generation opts to share entrées or order appetizers or kid’s meals to save money.

item.title: Meet the finance duo behind Dave’s Hot Chicken’s $1 billion deal as Gen Z flocks to the brand
item.description: Dave's has 2 million followers on Instagram and over 4 million on TikTok.

item.title: Paramount Buys Bari Weiss’s Free Press, Starting a New Era at CBS News
item.description: Bari Weiss, a founder of The Free Press, will become editor in chief of CBS News.

item.title: OpenAI Agrees to Use Computer Chips From AMD
item.description: Weeks after a $100 billion agreement to use computer chips from Nvidia, OpenAI has signed a similar deal with a rival chipmaker.

item.title: How Bari Weiss of The Free Press Won the Top Job at CBS News
item.description: At The Free Press, she battled “wokeness” and buddied up with billionaires. Now she’s the editor in chief of CBS News.

item.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
item.description: Sébastien Lecornu’s departure ratcheted up pressure on President Emmanuel Macron to call snap parliamentary elections.

item.title: The AI bubble will pop. Intelligence won’t
item.description: ChatGPT, Gemini and Claude are extraordinary feats of engineering, but they don’t represent sustainable AI.

item.title: Would you tell your coworkers your salary? Gen Z employees are doing so, and here’s why that’s good for companies
item.description: Legally, employees have the right to talk about their salaries with coworkers. But that doesn’t stop HR executives from being nervous about the practi...

item.title: Open enrollment: Two weeks that influence a year of care
item.description: It’s one of the most important times of the year for employees, but also one of the easiest to overlook.

item.title: Can Cory Doctorow’s Book ‘Enshittification’ Change the Tech Debate?
item.description: Cory Doctorow’s new book looks to offer comfort, and solutions, to the inescapable feeling that digital platforms have gotten worse.

item.title: French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
item.description: Sébastien Lecornu’s departure ratcheted up pressure on President Emmanuel Macron to call snap parliamentary elections.

item.title: Nobel Prizes 2025: What to Know
item.description: The awards are being announced this week.

item.title: With Trump’s Gaza Plan on the Line, Negotiators Gather in Egypt for Talks
item.description: Though significant issues remain to be hashed out between Israel and Hamas, some are saying that after two years of death and destruction, a breakthro...

item.title: Fighting in Gaza Continues Before Hamas-Israel Talks
item.description: Smoke rose above Gaza, where fighting has continued as Hamas and Israel planned to hold indirect talks in Egypt on the war in Gaza. Significant issues...

item.title: Ukraine’s Secret Weapons Spending Faces Questions After Internal Review
item.description: The government reviews show the country’s challenge as U.S. support wanes and Kyiv pivots to production from a domestic arms industry with a long hist...
